## Downloading and Prepping the Data
```{r}
# Load Libraries
library(gmodels)
library(e1071)
library(caret)
library(class)
library(C50)
library(neuralnet)

# Downloading and Prepping the Data
hr <- read.csv("HRDataset_v14.csv", stringsAsFactors = T)


# Null Unnecessary Columns
hr$Ã¯..Employee_Name <- NULL
hr$DOB <- NULL
hr$MarriedID <- NULL
hr$MaritalStatusID <- NULL
hr$GenderID <- NULL
hr$State <- NULL
hr$Zip <- NULL
hr$EmpStatusID <- NULL
hr$DeptID <- NULL
hr$ManagerID <- NULL
hr$PositionID <- NULL
hr$DateofHire <- NULL
hr$DateofTermination <- NULL
hr$LastPerformanceReview_Date <- NULL

summary(hr)

# Use model.matrix to Convert Factors to Dummy Variables
hr_d <- as.data.frame(model.matrix(~.-1,hr))
str(hr_d)

# Randomize the Rows
set.seed(12345)
hr_random <- hr_d[sample(nrow(hr_d)),]

#Normalize the Data
normalize <- function(x) {
  return ((x - min(x)) / (max(x) - min(x)))
}

# Normalize Everything
hr_norm <- as.data.frame(lapply(hr_random, normalize))

```

## Run Linear Regression
```{r}
hr_model1 <- lm(formula = Salary ~ ., data = hr_norm, family = "binomial")
summary(hr_model1)
```
